snippet: Natural gas overtook coal as the top source of United States electric power generation for the first time ever this spring.
abstract: SNL Energy releases report finding natural gas overtook coal as largest source of electric power in United States for the first time in April, 2015; report, based on Energy Dept data, found that 31 percent of electric power was generated from natural gas and 30 percent from coal.
lead_paragraph: Natural gas overtook coal as the top source of United States electric power generation for the first time ever this spring.

headline.main: Natural Gas Overtakes Coal in U.S. Electric Generation
headline.print_headline: Natural Gas Overtakes Coal in U.S. Electric Generation
